headline.main: Boston Police Investigating Overnight Fire and Fatal Shooting
headline.print_headline: Boston Police Investigating Overnight Fire and Fatal Shooting

docs.snippet: Boston police are investigating an incident in which officers responding to an overnight call arrived at a flaming apartment building to discover a man who had been shot dead and an injured woman, a police spokeswoman said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Boston police are investigating an incident in which officers responding to an overnight call arrived at a flaming apartment building to discover a man who had been shot dead and an injured woman, a police spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

headline.main: New York Governor Bans Non-Essential State Travel to Indiana
headline.print_headline: New York Governor Bans Non-Essential State Travel to Indiana

docs.snippet: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Tuesday banned non-essential state travel to Indiana in support of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender citizens....
docs.lead_paragraph: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Tuesday banned non-essential state travel to Indiana in support of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender citizens.

headline.main: U.S. Carries Out More Air Strikes Against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Carries Out More Air Strikes Against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria

docs.snippet: U.S. and allied military forces have carried out eight air strikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria since Monday, according to a U.S. military statement on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. and allied military forces have carried out eight air strikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria since Monday, according to a U.S. military statement on Tuesday.

headline.main: U.S. Concede Another Late Goal in Swiss Draw
headline.print_headline: U.S. Concede Another Late Goal in Swiss Draw

docs.snippet: Switzerland's Valentin Stocker netted an equalizer as United States continued their recent habit of conceding late goals and were held to a 1-1 draw in a friendly on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Switzerland's Valentin Stocker netted an equalizer as United States continued their recent habit of conceding late goals and were held to a 1-1 draw in a friendly on Tuesday.

headline.main: Genuine Democracy? Nigeria Has Chance to Rewrite Script
headline.print_headline: Genuine Democracy? Nigeria Has Chance to Rewrite Script

docs.snippet: The victory of opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari in Nigeria's presidential election could mark a turning point toward genuine democracy for the country, improving the image and moral standing of Africa's troubled giant....
docs.lead_paragraph: The victory of opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari in Nigeria's presidential election could mark a turning point toward genuine democracy for the country, improving the image and moral standing of Africa's troubled giant.

headline.main: Purported Kidnappers Want Apology From California Police
headline.print_headline: Purported Kidnappers Want Apology From California Police

docs.snippet: Two major California newspapers say they've received emails from a person claiming responsibility for a woman's abduction, including one demanding that police apologize to the woman for calling it a hoax....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two major California newspapers say they've received emails from a person claiming responsibility for a woman's abduction, including one demanding that police apologize to the woman for calling it a hoax.

headline.main: It May Be Necessary to Stop Clock at Iran Nuclear Talks: German Source
headline.print_headline: It May Be Necessary to Stop Clock at Iran Nuclear Talks: German Source

docs.snippet: It may be necessary to "stop the clock" at nuclear talks between Iran and world powers with a midnight deadline for a preliminary political deal approaching, as the two sides grapple with difficult issues, a German delegation source said on Tuesda...
docs.lead_paragraph: It may be necessary to "stop the clock" at nuclear talks between Iran and world powers with a midnight deadline for a preliminary political deal approaching, as the two sides grapple with difficult issues, a German delegation source said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Captors Killed, Prosecutor Injured in Istanbul Hostage Shootout: Website
headline.print_headline: Captors Killed, Prosecutor Injured in Istanbul Hostage Shootout: Website

docs.snippet: A website with links to a Turkish far-left group which has been holding a prosecutor captive in Istanbul said on its Twitter feed late on Tuesday that the hostage had been shot and injured, whilst his three captors had been killed....
docs.lead_paragraph: A website with links to a Turkish far-left group which has been holding a prosecutor captive in Istanbul said on its Twitter feed late on Tuesday that the hostage had been shot and injured, whilst his three captors had been killed.

headline.main: U.S. Gives Up Another Late Goal in Exhibition Tie at Switzerland
headline.print_headline: US Gives Up Another Late Goal in 1-1 Tie at Switzerland

docs.snippet: Jozy Altidore of the United States, which took the lead on a Brek Shea goal in the 45th minute, was ejected in the 68th minute, turning the game....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jozy Altidore of the United States, which took the lead on a Brek Shea goal in the 45th minute, was ejected in the 68th minute, turning the game.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Says No 'Automatic' Ground Offensive in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia Says No 'Automatic' Ground Offensive in Yemen

docs.snippet: Saudi Arabia said on Tuesday it would only send ground troops into Yemen against the Houthi militia if such operations became necessary, after the fiercest day of clashes on the border since it began air strikes began last week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia said on Tuesday it would only send ground troops into Yemen against the Houthi militia if such operations became necessary, after the fiercest day of clashes on the border since it began air strikes began last week.
